etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Nature: a weekly journal of science. Quot. 1870 refers to a paper apparently read in 1869 to German learned society by a Dr Zinke, but this has not been traced

definitions: "phenylacetic acid", a white, crystalline acid with a sweet odour, C₆ H₅ CH₂ COOH, used in chemical synthesis and perfume manufacture.
